TITLE: Creating a Table with Primary Key
DESCRIPTION: SQL command to create a table with an auto-incrementing primary key, ensuring each record has a unique identifier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/003-creating-tables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE users

    id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    username VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    about TEXT,
    birthday DATE,
    active BOOL
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing an INNER JOIN in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to perform an INNER JOIN between the 'users' and 'posts' tables. It matches users with their associated posts based on the condition 'users.id = posts.user_id'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/011-join.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT *
FROM users
INNER JOIN posts
ON users.id = posts.user_id;
```

TITLE: Selecting Data Using Subquery in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query selects all columns from the CUSTOMERS table where the ID is in the result of a subquery. The subquery returns IDs of customers with a salary greater than 4500.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-sub-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT *
FROM CUSTOMERS
WHERE ID IN (
    SELECT ID
    FROM CUSTOMERS
    WHERE SALARY > 4500
);
```

TITLE: Using AND Operator with WHERE Clause
DESCRIPTION: SQL query demonstrating how to combine multiple conditions using the AND operator to filter data more specifically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/006-where.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='bobby' AND active=true;
```

TITLE: Combining Results with SQL UNION Clause
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query combines results from two SELECT statements using the UNION clause. It joins the customers and orders tables using LEFT JOIN and RIGHT JOIN, then combines the results without duplicates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/014-unions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT id, name, amount, date
   FROM customer
   LEFT JOIN orders
   ON customers.id = orders.customer_id
UNION
   SELECT id, name, amount, date
   FROM customer
   RIGHT JOIN orders
   ON customers.id = orders.customer_id
```

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT column_name FROM table_name WHERE column=some_value;
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to insert multiple user records with a single INSERT statement by specifying multiple value sets. This is more efficient than executing multiple separate INSERT statements.

```

  ('user4', 'user4@devdojo.com', true),
  ('user5', 'user5@devdojo.com', true);

DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to insert sample data into the 'users' and 'posts' tables. It creates four users and five posts, establishing relationships between users and their posts.

TITLE: Creating Database and Tables for JOIN Examples in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a new database called 'demo_joins' and two tables: 'users' and 'posts'. The 'users' table has 'id' and 'username' columns, while the 'posts' table has 'id', 'user_id', and 'title' columns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/011-join.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE DATABASE demo_joins;

USE demo_joins;

CREATE TABLE users
(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    username VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE posts
(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    user_id INT,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);
```

TITLE: Sorting Results with ORDER BY in SQL
DESCRIPTION: A SELECT query that retrieves user data and sorts it alphabetically by username in ascending order using the ORDER BY clause.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/007-order-and-group-by.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT id, username FROM users ORDER BY username;
```

TITLE: SQL COUNT Function with GROUP BY Example
DESCRIPTION: Counts the total number of items purchased by each customer and groups the results by customer name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-having-clause_aggregate-functions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT COUNT(item) AS Total_Items, customer_name
FROM purchase
GROUP BY customer_name;
```

TITLE: Performing a LEFT JOIN in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a LEFT JOIN between the 'users' and 'posts' tables. It retrieves all users, including those without associated posts, and displays NULL for missing post data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/011-join.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT *
FROM users
LEFT JOIN posts
ON users.id = posts.user_id;
```

TITLE: Using LIKE Operator for Pattern Matching
DESCRIPTION: SQL query demonstrating how to use the LIKE operator with wildcard patterns to find usernames containing a specific character.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/006-where.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%y%';
```

TITLE: SQL HAVING Clause Basic Syntax
DESCRIPTION: The basic syntax for using the HAVING clause in SQL queries. The HAVING clause filters group results based on specified conditions and must follow the GROUP BY clause.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-having-clause_aggregate-functions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
GROUP BY column_name(s)
HAVING condition
ORDER BY column_name(s);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SQL AVG Function with GROUP BY Example
DESCRIPTION: Calculates the average price of purchases for each customer and groups the results by customer name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-having-clause_aggregate-functions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT AVG(price) AS Avg_Purchase, customer_name
FROM purchase
GROUP BY customer_name;
```

DESCRIPTION: SQL query demonstrating how to select data from a table by explicitly specifying the database name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/003-creating-tables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

```

TITLE: Selecting Specific Columns in SQL
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to retrieve only the username and email columns from the users table. This SELECT statement specifies exactly which columns to include in the result set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/004-basic-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT username, email FROM users;
```

TITLE: Updating a Single Column in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to update a single column for a specific record in a SQL database. It uses the UPDATE statement with a WHERE clause to target a specific user by ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/009-update.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
UPDATE users SET username='bobbyiliev' WHERE id=1;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SQL SUM Function with GROUP BY Example
DESCRIPTION: Calculates the total sum of prices for each customer's purchases and groups the results by customer name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-having-clause_aggregate-functions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT SUM(price) AS Total_Bill, customer_name
FROM purchase
GROUP BY customer_name;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Inserting Data from Another Table Using SQL INSERT with SELECT
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to insert records into the users table by selecting data from the prospect_users table with a condition. This technique allows for efficient batch insertions from existing data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/008-insert.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
INSERT INTO users (username, email, active)
SELECT username, email, active
FROM prospect_users
WHERE active=true;
```

TITLE: Selecting All Columns from a Table in SQL
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use the SELECT statement with a wildcard (*) to retrieve all columns from a table. This example selects all data from the users table.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/de/content/004-basic-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT * FROM users;
```

TITLE: LEFT JOIN with WHERE Condition
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates filtering in WHERE clause to find posts containing 'SQL' along with user data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/011-join.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT users.*, posts.*
FROM users
LEFT JOIN posts
ON posts.user_id = users.id
WHERE posts.title LIKE '%SQL%';
```

TITLE: Basic RIGHT JOIN Query
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a basic RIGHT JOIN between users and posts tables, showing all posts including those without matching users.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/011-join.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT *
FROM users
RIGHT JOIN posts
ON users.id = posts.user_id;
```

TITLE: Deleting Data Using Subquery in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query deletes records from the CUSTOMERS table where the AGE is present in the result of a subquery. The subquery selects ages greater than or equal to 27 from a backup table.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-sub-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
DELETE FROM CUSTOMERS
WHERE AGE IN (
    SELECT AGE
    FROM CUSTOMERS_BKP
    WHERE AGE >= 27
);
```

TITLE: Selecting Unique Usernames with DISTINCT
DESCRIPTION: SQL query using the DISTINCT keyword to select only unique username values from the users table, eliminating duplicates from the result set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/005-select.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT DISTINCT username FROM users;
```

TITLE: Using IS Operator for NULL Values
DESCRIPTION: SQL query demonstrating how to check for NULL values using the IS operator, as the equals operator doesn't work for NULL checks.

SELECT * FROM users WHERE about IS NULL;

TITLE: SQL HAVING with AVG and ORDER BY Example
DESCRIPTION: Calculates average purchase price for each customer, filters to show only averages greater than 550, and orders results by customer name in descending order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-having-clause_aggregate-functions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```

FROM purchase
GROUP BY customer_name
HAVING AVG(price) > 550
ORDER BY customer_name DESC;

TITLE: Creating a Multi-Column Index with Primary Field Order
DESCRIPTION: SQL command to create a composite index optimized for queries involving both birthday and active status columns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/003-creating-tables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the fundamental syntax for inserting data into a database table using SQL. Shows the structure with column names and corresponding values.

TITLE: Updating Data Using Subquery in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query updates the SALARY in the CUSTOMERS table by multiplying it by 0.25 for customers whose AGE is present in the result of a subquery. The subquery selects ages greater than or equal to 27 from a backup table.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-sub-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

CODE:
```

SET SALARY = SALARY * 0.25
WHERE AGE IN (
    SELECT AGE

    WHERE AGE >= 27
);

TITLE: Combining Results with SQL UNION ALL Clause
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query combines results from two SELECT statements using the UNION ALL clause. It joins the customers and orders tables using LEFT JOIN and RIGHT JOIN, then combines the results including duplicates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/014-unions.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT id, name, amount, date
   FROM customers
   LEFT JOIN orders
   ON customers.id = order.customer_id
UNION ALL
   SELECT id, name, amount, date
   FROM customers
   RIGHT JOIN orders
   ON customers.id = orders.customer_id;
```

TITLE: Using BETWEEN Operator for Range Queries
DESCRIPTION: SQL query demonstrating how to use the BETWEEN operator to select values within a specified inclusive range.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/006-where.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT * FROM users WHERE id BETWEEN 3 AND 6;
```

TITLE: Equivalent RIGHT JOIN Query

SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-sql/blob/main/ebook/en/content/100-mysqldump.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#!/bin/bash

##
# Get a list of all databases except the system databases that are not needed
##
DATABASES=$(echo "show databases;" | mysql | grep -Ev "(Database|information_schema|mysql|performance_schema)")

DATE=$(date +%d%m%Y)
TIME=$(date +%s)
BACKUP_DIR=/home/your_user/backup

##
# Create Backup Directory
##

if [ ! -d ${BACKUP_DIR} ]; then
  mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR} 
fi

##
# Backup all databases
##

for DB in $DATABASES;
do
    mysqldump --single-transaction --skip-lock-tables $DB | gzip > ${BACKUP_DIR}/$DATE-$DB.sql.gz
done
```
